channel.title: Quartz Jemu on
channel.description: Recent content in Quartz Jemu on

item.title: cuda
item.description: Nvidia installation instructions. Can be a pain, usually is. Note that [[notes/Unattended Upgrades]] can ruin your day by auto-upgrading drivers apprently, which will at best require a reboot before the GPUs can be used again and at worst screw up your whole package situation such that you may have to nuke everything and reinstall drivers/cuda things.

item.title: duti
item.description: https://github.com/moretension/duti A [[notes/OS/macOS]] file association thingy.

item.title: Elastic Net
item.description: A [[notes/ML/Regularization]] technique used form [[notes/ML/Linear Regression]] to [[deep learning]]. Spawned [[notes/ML/fwelnet]].

item.title: exa
item.description: exa is neat as it shows pretty colors, optional [[notes/tools/git]] status, and icons. It’s part of the [[notes/tools/Modern Unix]] stack, supplementing the venerable ls.

item.title: Fixing file associations on macOS
item.description: When you try to open a small [[YAML]] file and nothing happens, only to realize that the behemoth that is Xcode has been starting up for what feels like minutes — that’s when it’s time to recheck file type associations on your machine.

item.title: fwelnet
item.description: [[notes/programming/R]] package on GitHub

item.title: git
item.description: Should this be its own tag? At some place I’d need to collect useful commands, like adding the following to .

item.title: git-delta
item.description: https://github.com/dandavison/delta Named git-delta in most package managers. A nicer diff . One of the [[notes/tools/Modern Unix]] tools. See also [[notes/tools/git]]

item.title: Homebrew
item.description: Apparently either beloved or hated, depending on.. things I haven’t quite looked into and probably would rather avoid. Works for me.

item.title: Linear Regression
item.description: Good ol’ $\mathbf{X}(\mathbf{X}’\mathbf{X})^{-1}\mathbf{X}’\mathbf{Y}$ amirite Can be [[notes/ML/Regularization|regularized]]

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: Wonder what happens if a note has the same name as a tag.

item.title: macOS
item.description: OS of choice and habit. Maybe I should jot down some things on [[Alfred]] or [[notes/tools/Homebrew]] or [[iTerm2]] or something.

item.title: mlr3
item.description: [[notes/programming/R]] package / framework for [[notes/ML/ML]] stuff. There is a book available and soon to be published.

item.title: Modern Unix
item.description: Main list on GitHub See also Julia Evan’s supplementary list. Honorary Mentions [[lsd]], [[notes/tools/exa]] [[ripgrep]], [[fd]], [[sd]] [[notes/tools/delta]] dust, diskus, and duf zoxide and broot For [[docker]]: lazydocker, no Ubuntu package unfortunately, [[Golang]] -based ctop Haven’t given mcfly a proper go yet but might be nice.

item.title: nala
item.description: Install from here: https://gitlab.com/volian/nala/-/wikis/Installation Run sudo nala fetch to test available package mirrors and pick the fast/reliable ones.

item.title: R
item.description: This is only a test [[notes/tools/rig]] [[notes/tools/renv]] [[RSPM]] [[CRAN]]

item.title: Regularization
item.description: You know it’s important if the DL folk gave it a different name.

item.title: Rust
item.description: Learning Resources The Book The Book, but interactive Rust by Example Rustlings Faster than lime’s neat post(s) This Week in Rust Read Rust [!

item.title: Shell Scripting
item.description: I always look up the same things again and again and/or refer to old scripts where I’ve done the looking up.

item.title: starship ðŸš€
item.description: Anyone spending a lot of time in the [[terminal]] might have an opinion about what the shell prompt should look like.

item.title: typst
item.description: https://github.com/typst/typst Docs: https://typst.app/docs/tutorial/writing-in-typst/ Web-editor (overleaf-like) https://typst.app/ A [[notes/programming/Rust]]-based [[LaTeX]]-alternative in the very early stages as of March 2023. It looks really promising though, and [[pandoc]] has support for it as of [version 3.

item.title: Ubuntu
item.description: Useful links Upgrading to 22.04 Installing [[notes/tools/Modern Unix]] may require [[notes/tools/Homebrew]] for many tools, at least it makes it easier and/or gets more recent versions.

item.title: Unattended Upgrades
item.description: Config for apt on [[notes/OS/Ubuntu]]: 1 /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades To disable auto-updating nvidia / [[notes/OS/cuda]] packages: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 // Python regular expressions, matching packages to exclude from upgrading Unattended-Upgrade::Package-Blacklist { // Do not upgrade nvidia stuff "nvidia*"; "libnvidia*"; "cuda*"; // .

item.title: Zed
item.description: https://zed.dev/features A neat GUI editor written in [[notes/programming/Rust]] and currently in beta. Has some nice features and reminds me of Sublime Text.

item.title: zsh
item.description: A neat shell, on both [[notes/OS/macOS]] and [[notes/OS/Ubuntu]]. As far as I remember not quite [[POSIX]]-compliant like [[bash]] and therefore(?) not as portable, but a lot nicer.
